resources.string: Çré Çrémad Bhaktivedänta Näräyaëa Gosvämé Mahäräja
- Worship Me and Offer Obeisances to Me ...mad yäjé mäà namaskuru -

TheBhagavad-gétä(The Song of God) was spoken by Çré Kåñëa to his disciple and friend Arjuna, over 5,000 years ago, just before the beginning of the epic Mahäbhärata War. Since that time seekers of sacred wisdom have turned to the Bhagavad-gétä for answers to the most profound mysteries of life. The material in this book was taken from lectures on the confidential meanings of the Bhagavad-gétä, given by one of the most prominent spiritual authorities of the modern era, Çré Çrémad Bhaktivedänta Näräyaëa Gosvämé Mahäräja. He is a fully realized spiritual master in the Gauòéya Vaiñëava disciplic succession, extant since the time of Lord Kåñëa Himself. Çréla Bhaktivedänta Näräyaëa Gosvämé Mahäräja has been teaching the ancient science of Kåñëa consciousness for over sixty years. In these talks, Çréla Näräyaëa Mahäräja reveals truths of the Bhagavad-gétäthat have been carefully maintained and handed down in an unbroken succession of self-realized spiritual teachers for the last 5,000 years. The eminent 19th century saint and scholar, Çréla Saccidänanda Bhaktivinoda Öhäkura has said in his explanation of theGétä, “When the supremely compassionate Lord Çré Kåñëa, whose vows are infallible, spoke Çrémad Bhagavad-gétä, He seemed to be directing His words at His friend Arjuna. Actually however, He manifested this scripture for the deliverance of the whole world. It is the very form of deep reflection on the essential meanings of all the Vedas, and it is the sole means of attaining the highest goal.” Citing Çré Kåñëa’s own words in the Bhagavad-gétäto establish pure love and devotion to God as the topmost goal of all spiritual seekers, Çréla Näräyaëa Mahäräja explains the journey of the soul towards that ultimate level of spiritual consciousness. Of all the verses in the Bhagavad-gétä, the most revealing is in the final chapter where Çré Kåñëa says, “Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me and offer your respects unto Me. Thus you will certainly come to me. I promise you this because you are My very dear friend.” (Bhagavad-gétä 18.65) In this verse are four distinct instructions, which offer devotees of different eligibilities the opportunity to connect with the Lord in perfect loving service. Çréla Näräyaëa Mahäräja brings this subject to life through enchanting tales from the lives of real devotees, some quite famous, and others virtually unknown. The common theme is the extraordinary connection they experience with the Lord by the bestowal of His sweet, unlimited compassion and mercy. It is the sincere hope and prayer of the editors that by hearing these wonderful deliberations, all may find inspiration and guidance in their own sacred calling. On behalf of the many devotees serving in Gauòéya Vedänta Publications, we offer this publication to Çréla Gurudeva, praying that he be pleased with our efforts. Humbly in the service of Hari, Guru and Vaiñëavas, Bhaktivedänta Vaikhanas Mahäräja Çré Rädhäñöamé 8th September, 2008 Bangalore, India
